Computer_Science_52.News Finding: Hyperspectral and RGB imaging not only address this issue, Ge said, but should also further speed the process of simultaneously comparing multiple traits among plant varieties.
Computer_Science_52.Paper Finding: Second, hyperspectral images are capably of capturing the full spectral signature of plants, allowing more advanced analytical tools such as PLSR for modeling of leaf biochemical properties.
Computer_Science_52.News Context: In killing the plant, these methods kept the researchers from observing how it would have grown and developed afterward. Hyperspectral and RGB imaging not only address this issue, Ge said, but should also further speed the process of simultaneously comparing multiple traits among plant varieties. "How to capture all of these dynamic traits is really a challenging task without these high-throughput systems," Ge said.
Computer_Science_52.Paper Context: First, using different image bands in the hyperspectral cube, plants can be more accurately segmented from the background and leaves can be accurately distinguished from stems (which is quite challenging with a RGB or NIR image). Second, hyperspectral images are capably of capturing the full spectral signature of plants, allowing more advanced analytical tools such as PLSR for modeling of leaf biochemical properties. Based on these previous knowledges, hyperspectral imaging is suggested as a powerful tool in plant phenotyping to complement RGB analysis (to obtain plant chemical traits in addition to morphological traits).
Computer_Science_52.text:
['Finding A: Hyperspectral and RGB imaging not only address this issue, Ge said, but should also further speed the process of simultaneously comparing multiple traits among plant varieties.
Finding B: Second, hyperspectral images are capably of capturing the full spectral signature of plants, allowing more advanced analytical tools such as PLSR for modeling of leaf biochemical properties.']
Computer_Science_52.displayed_text:
Finding A: Hyperspectral and RGB imaging not only address this issue, Ge said, but should also further speed the process of simultaneously comparing multiple traits among plant varieties.
Finding B: Second, hyperspectral images are capably of capturing the full spectral signature of plants, allowing more advanced analytical tools such as PLSR for modeling of leaf biochemical properties.

Computer_Science_60.News Finding: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Computer_Science_60.Paper Finding: We are less sure about a possible explanation for lower acceptance for mobile phone behaviors among professionals in the West.
Computer_Science_60.News Context: Similarly, 50 percent of men said it was acceptable to answer a call at a power lunch, compared to 26 percent of women. Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast. Higher-income professionals had less tolerance for smartphone use in business meetings.
Computer_Science_60.Paper Context: A possible explanation for more sensitivity to mobile phone use in the Southwest may be the emphasis on hospitality and manners. We are less sure about a possible explanation for lower acceptance for mobile phone behaviors among professionals in the West. We are intrigued by the result that professionals with higher incomes are less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings.

Computer_Science_449.News Finding: The analysis also revealed that bots amplify a message's volume and visibility until it's more likely to be shared broadly, despite only representing a small fraction of the accounts that spread viral messages.
Computer_Science_449.Paper Finding: Relatively few accounts are responsible for a large share of the traffic that carries misinformation.
Computer_Science_449.News Context: The brief length of this time -- two to 10 seconds -- highlights the challenges of countering the spread of misinformation online. "This study finds that bots significantly contribute to the spread of misinformation online -- as well as shows how quickly these messages can spread," said Filippo Menczer, a professor in the IU School of Informatics, Computing and Engineering, who led the study. The analysis also revealed that bots amplify a message's volume and visibility until it's more likely to be shared broadly, despite only representing a small fraction of the accounts that spread viral messages.
Computer_Science_449.Paper Context: Our analysis provides quantitative empirical evidence of the key role played by social bots in the viral spread of fake news online. Relatively few accounts are responsible for a large share of the traffic that carries misinformation. These accounts are likely bots, and we uncovered several manipulation strategies they use.

Computer_Science_tweet_6.News Finding: Core #language skill in typically and atypically developing #children, including those with #autism spectrum disorders, is stable from infancy to adolescence. This suggests that when a child’s language skills are lagging, early intervention is best @username
Computer_Science_tweet_6.Paper Finding: With respect to the four challenges posed at the outset, clear evidence emerged for individual variation in a core language skill at each of 11 ages, for convergence of multiple indices of language at each age on latent variables representing a core language skill, for the homotypic and heterotypic stability of core language skill over the long term, and for the robustness of long-term stability of core language skill in atypically developing children with several different types of health risk.
Computer_Science_tweet_6.News Context: Core #language skill in typically and atypically developing #children, including those with #autism spectrum disorders, is stable from infancy to adolescence. This suggests that when a child’s language skills are lagging, early intervention is best @username
Computer_Science_tweet_6.Paper Context: Individual differences tell us about the distribution of language skill, and their stability tells us about the nature and ontogeny of that language skill. With respect to the four challenges posed at the outset, clear evidence emerged for individual variation in a core language skill at each of 11 ages, for convergence of multiple indices of language at each age on latent variables representing a core language skill, for the homotypic and heterotypic stability of core language skill over the long term, and for the robustness of long-term stability of core language skill in atypically developing children with several different types of health risk. Thus, a consistent personological characteristic, experience, or environment can carry stability.

['Finding A: Core #language skill in typically and atypically developing #children, including those with #autism spectrum disorders, is stable from infancy to adolescence. This suggests that when a child’s language skills are lagging, early intervention is best @username
Finding B: With respect to the four challenges posed at the outset, clear evidence emerged for individual variation in a core language skill at each of 11 ages, for convergence of multiple indices of language at each age on latent variables representing a core language skill, for the homotypic and heterotypic stability of core language skill over the long term, and for the robustness of long-term stability of core language skill in atypically developing children with several different types of health risk.']

Computer_Science_386.News Finding: Even at more informal business lunches, the majority of people thought writing a text message is rude -- 66 percent said writing or sending a text message is inappropriate.
Computer_Science_386.Paper Finding: Table 4 shows the perceived appropriateness of these various mobile phone behaviors during informal, offsite lunch meetings.
Computer_Science_386.News Context: 87 percent of people said answering a call was rarely or never acceptable in business meetings. Even at more informal business lunches, the majority of people thought writing a text message is rude -- 66 percent said writing or sending a text message is inappropriate. Men were nearly twice as likely as women to consider mobile phone use at a business lunch acceptable.
Computer_Science_386.Paper Context: More than half of the respondents stated the remaining four actions were rarely or never acceptable. Table 4 shows the perceived appropriateness of these various mobile phone behaviors during informal, offsite lunch meetings. Roughly two thirds of respondents thought the following actions were rarely or never appropriate: writing and sending text messages or emails (66.3%), answering a call (61.4%), and browsing the Internet (61.4%).

Computer_Science_315.News Finding: "Here we have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive deep brain stimulation," said Dr. Starr.
Computer_Science_315.Paper Finding: We have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive DBS in PD using a fully implantable device, with feedback control provided by a cortical gamma band oscillation related to the emergence of dyskinesia, a common adverse effect of levodopa therapy and of STN DBS.
Computer_Science_315.News Context: An adaptive system like the one being tested here could offer an effective alternative and may also limit adverse effects of traditional deep brain stimulation, but considerable testing remains to be done. "Here we have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive deep brain stimulation," said Dr. Starr. "We are now planning larger, longer-term trials to determine how effective this system is in managing the symptoms of patients with Parkinson's disease."
Computer_Science_315.Paper Context: The zoomed in views of state changes in Figures 3c and 4b indicate that changes in classifier state were appropriately triggered by changes in gamma power. We have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive DBS in PD using a fully implantable device, with feedback control provided by a cortical gamma band oscillation related to the emergence of dyskinesia, a common adverse effect of levodopa therapy and of STN DBS. While the total energy delivered by adaptive stimulation was substantially less than that of open-loop stimulation, blinded clinical ratings confirmed similar efficacy for both approaches.
Computer_Science_315.text:
['Finding A: "Here we have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive deep brain stimulation," said Dr. Starr.
Finding B: We have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive DBS in PD using a fully implantable device, with feedback control provided by a cortical gamma band oscillation related to the emergence of dyskinesia, a common adverse effect of levodopa therapy and of STN DBS.']
Computer_Science_315.displayed_text:

Finding B: We have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive DBS in PD using a fully implantable device, with feedback control provided by a cortical gamma band oscillation related to the emergence of dyskinesia, a common adverse effect of levodopa therapy and of STN DBS.

Computer_Science_203.News Finding: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn't cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Computer_Science_203.Paper Finding: Overwhelmingly, taking or making calls during meetings were the most commonly cited examples, with more than one half of employees who commented about meetings stating they had recently observed this behavior and considered it disrespectful.
Computer_Science_203.News Context: Chances are, just having your phone out is offending somebody: A full 20 percent of professionals said simply having your phone out at a business lunch is rude. Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn't cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings. With a national sample of more than 550 full-time working professionals, the study reveals what business professionals perceive as acceptable, courteous or rude use of mobile phones in the workplace.
Computer_Science_203.Paper Context: Altogether, 101 of the 204 employees (49.5%) commented on mobile phone behaviors in meetings. Overwhelmingly, taking or making calls during meetings were the most commonly cited examples, with more than one half of employees who commented about meetings stating they had recently observed this behavior and considered it disrespectful. Writing and reading text messages or emails followed, with roughly one third of the employees citing these actions as recent examples of disrespectful phone use.
Computer_Science_203.text:
['Finding A: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn\'t cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding B: Overwhelmingly, taking or making calls during meetings were the most commonly cited examples, with more than one half of employees who commented about meetings stating they had recently observed this behavior and considered it disrespectful.']
Computer_Science_203.displayed_text:
Finding A: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn't cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding B: Overwhelmingly, taking or making calls during meetings were the most commonly cited examples, with more than one half of employees who commented about meetings stating they had recently observed this behavior and considered it disrespectful.
